noun.description: The worst or least favourable condition, value, or amount. Opposed to optimum.

adjective.description: Worst, least favourable, especially under a particular set of circumstances.

origin: Early 19th century. From classical Latin pessimum lowest quality, worst condition, greatest detriment, use as noun of neuter of pessimus worst from the same base as pēior worse + -imus, extended form of suffix forming superlatives. Compare German Pessimum, noun.
